Articles.Content:
Modified my Mun rocket and after the gravity turn it began to shake, how to fix this? And I used the struts and the only change was that now, after the

separation, it doesn't shakes much.

Help me:wink:

Edited June 14, 2013 by EuSouONumero345
To fix instability add more struts or build a more stable (balanced) rocket.
But I don't know where to put the struts
High school physics is your friend. Go back to high school or google.

I'll try this way.

So, here's a picture of the rocket:

http://i1273.photobucket.com/albums/y413/Daniel34559/screenshot0_zps630ff409.png

Try disabling the gimballing feature of the outside engines. use "stitching" to vertically connect stacks to make them more rigid, and connect struts from the tanks to the engines especially. they are massive and they apply large forces. In addition to all that, place either a docking port ora probe core down in the middle of that heavy section. When the flight starts, right click it and select "control from here" this will make ASAS wobble less because its determining the ship's overall orientation from a point near the center of mass that can't wobble so much.

See my tutorial for some more detailed explanations of these features.

Thank you guys very much!Now my rocket is very stable and maybe, just maybe, I will make my very first landing on Duna with Kerbals!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Now I am flying with my rocket, game is paused, I will reply if I do this landing, or just orbit.
